overview:
Dev Bhatia is a CEO with a track record of success in internet advertising, application services, content and analytic software. He has grown three different start-ups to multi-million dollar revenues. His companies have raised more than $30 million in venture capital, and investors in these companies have more than tripled their investments.

Dev is the CEO of SRCH2, the next generation of enterprise search. SRCH2 was developed by a team of Stanford and Google alums to address the search needs of a data-driven world. Check it out at http://srch2.com!

Dev was Chief Revenue Officer of mShopper, the leader in mobile shopping. mShopper has relationships with the three largest U.S. wireless carriers, AT&T, Sprint, Verizon, and mobile-enables retailers including Best Buy, Target, Wal-Mart, Home Depot, The Gap, and many, many more.

Previously, Dev was Chairman and CEO of HotSocket, a web marketing/sales firm whose clients included AT&T, Chase, Discover, DoubleDay, Earthlink, FirstUSA, Verizon and many others and whose strategic partners included Acxiom, Experian, VNU/Claritas and Excite/MatchLogic.

Prior to this, Dev was VP-Brand Management at Yoyodyne, a web advertising pioneer, where he was responsible for products which represented more than 70% of company revenues prior to that company’s sale to Yahoo! in 1998. At Yoyodyne, Dev reported to Seth Godin, author of “Permission Marketing” and other important books.

In 1996, Dev wrote the business plan and raised seed capital for Screaming Media, a company which later went public, and is now a unit of Dow Jones MarketWatch. Dev is a Yale graduate, and has an MBA from Columbia University.
